info.title: Rapidata Order API
info.description: The API for the Rapidata Order service

post.description: A preview pipeline is automatically created and returned in the response.

post.summary: Creates a new job from a job definition and audience.
post.description:
If the audience is not already recruiting, recruiting is started automatically.
 The RecruitingStarted field indicates whether this happened.

post.summary: Creates a new revision for an existing job definition.
post.description:
Unspecified fields are inherited from the previous revision. Workflow and Referee must be
 provided together if either is specified.

parameters.name: definitionId
parameters.description: The id of the job definition to create a revision for.

get.summary: Gets the latest revision for a job definition.

parameters.name: definitionId
parameters.description: The id of the job definition.

delete.summary: Deletes a job definition and all its revisions.

parameters.name: definitionId
parameters.description: The id of the job definition to delete.

get.summary: Gets a job definition by its id.

parameters.name: definitionId
parameters.description: The id of the job definition to retrieve.

parameters.name: definitionId
parameters.description: The id of the job definition to update.

get.summary: Downloads the results of a job as a file attachment.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job to download results for.

get.summary: Gets a job by its id.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job to retrieve.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job to update.

get.summary: Gets the results of a job as a JSON string.
get.description: For file download, use the download-results endpoint instead.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The id of the job to get results for.

get.summary: Gets a specific revision for a job definition.

parameters.name: definitionId
parameters.description: The id of the job definition.

parameters.name: revisionNumber
parameters.description: The revision number to retrieve.

requestBody.description: The body content of the request

get.summary: Queries job definitions based on filter, page, and sort criteria.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The parameters for filtering, paging, and sorting

get.summary: Queries job revisions for a specific definition based on filter, page, and sort criteria.

parameters.name: definitionId
parameters.description: The id of the job definition

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The parameters for filtering, paging, and sorting

get.summary: Queries jobs based on filter, page, and sort criteria.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The parameters for filtering, paging, and sorting

get.summary: Queries orders based on a filter, page, and sort criteria.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The parameters for filtering, paging, and sorting

get.summary: Retrieves the orders aggregated by customer, with total amounts and most recent order informations.
Retrieves orders that are public and can be cloned by any user.
Retrieves an order by its id.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to update

requestBody.description: The body content of the request

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to delete

get.summary: Aggregates the results of an order and returns the result as a json body.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order

get.summary: Aggregates the results of an order and returns it as a file attachment.
get.description:
Returns the aggregated result as a file with a given name.
 The annotated type of the response represents the content type of the file.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order

post.summary: Used to create a new order.
Creates a new order with a custom pipeline.

requestBody.description: The body content of the request

post.summary: Notifies the admins that a user wants to create an order with an unsupported label type or data type.

requestBody.description: The body content of the request

post.description: In order to clone an order, the existing order must be marked as public.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to clone

requestBody.description: The body content of the request

post.description:
When an order is cloned only the necessary information is copied.
 In order to make changes to the order, it must be unlocked first.
 Unlocking the order will clone the entire dataset and its datapoints.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to unlock

patch.summary: Updates whether an order is a demo or not.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to update

parameters.name: isDemo
parameters.description: Whether to mark or unmark the order as a demo

patch.summary: Updates whether an order is public or not.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to update

parameters.name: isPublic
parameters.description: Whether to mark or unmark the order as public

post.description:
Once an order is created its order id and dataset id is returned.
 The dataset id can be used to fill the dataset with data points.
 Once submitted, the order will be locked and no further changes can be made.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to submit

requestBody.description: The model containing additional information for the submission.

post.summary: Approves an order that has been submitted for manual approval.
post.description:
An order is submitted for manual approval when the automatic approval process could not automatically
 determine if the order is safe to process.
 Once an order is approved, the pipeline will start processing the order.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to approve

patch.summary: Updates the name of an order.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to update

requestBody.description: The body content of the request

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to retry

post.summary: Pauses an order that is processing. Meaning all campaigns in the order will be paused.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to pause

post.summary: Puts the order into preview mode, where one can inspect what our labelers receive.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to submit

requestBody.description: The model containing additional information for the preview.

post.summary: Resumes a paused order. Meaning all campaigns in the order will be resumed.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: The id of the order to resume

orderName.description: The name of the new order

CloneOrderModel.description: The model for cloning an existing order.

precedingOrderId.description: Optional ID of the order that must complete before this order starts processing.

CreateComplexOrderModel.description: The model for creating a new order with a custom pipeline.

CreateJobDefinitionEndpoint_Input.description: The input for the create job definition endpoint.

definitionId.description: The id of the created job definition.

pipelineId.description: The id of the created preview pipeline.

CreateJobDefinitionEndpoint_Output.description: The result when a job definition has been created.

jobDefinitionId.description: The id of the job definition to use.

audienceId.description: The id of the audience to target.

revisionNumber.description: The revision number to use. If not specified, the latest revision will be used.

name.description: The name of the job. If not specified, defaults to "{definition name}:{revision number}".

priority.description: The priority of the job. Higher values mean higher priority. Default is 50.

CreateJobEndpoint_Input.description: The input for the create job endpoint.

jobId.description: The id of the created job.

recruitingStarted.description: Whether recruiting was automatically started for the audience.

CreateJobEndpoint_Output.description: The result when a job has been created.

workflow.description:
The workflow configuration. If not provided, inherits from the previous revision.
 Must be provided together with Referee if either is specified.

referee.description:
The referee configuration. If not provided, inherits from the previous revision.
 Must be provided together with Workflow if either is specified.

datasetId.description: The dataset id. If not provided, inherits from the previous revision.

featureFlags.description: The feature flags. If not provided, inherits from the previous revision.

aggregatorType.description: The aggregator type. If not provided, inherits from the previous revision.

CreateJobRevisionEndpoint_Input.description: The input for the create job revision endpoint.

revisionNumber.description: The revision number of the created job revision.

pipelineId.description: The id of the created preview pipeline.

CreateJobRevisionEndpoint_Output.description: The result when a job revision has been created.

orderName.description: The name is used as an identifier for an order and can be freely chosen.

workflow.description: The workflow helps to determine the tasks that need to be completed by the users.

referee.description: The referee is used to determine how many votes will be collected.

featureFlags.description: The feature flags are used to enable or disable certain features.

priority.description: The priority is used to prioritize over other orders.

stickyConfig.description: Configuration for sticky campaign behavior. Takes precedence over StickyState if both are provided.

userScoreDimensions.description: The user score dimensions are used to determine the score of the responses from the user.

demographicKeys.description: The demographic keys are used to determine which demographics to store on the responses from the user.

userFilters.description: The user filters are used to restrict the order to only collect votes from a specific demographic.

validationSetId.description:
The validation set id can be changed to point to a specific validation set. if not provided a sane default will be
 used.

selections.description: The selections are used to determine which tasks are shown to a user.

maxIterations.description: The maximum number of times a user is allowed to see the same rapid.

precedingOrderId.description: Optional ID of the order that must complete before this order starts processing.

CreateOrderModel.description: This model is used to create a simple order

dataType.description: The type of the data that was attempted to be ordered

labelType.description: The type of the labels that were attempted to be ordered

CreateUnsupportedOrderModel.description: The model for creating an order with an unsupported label type or data type.

DefinitionType.description: The type of the job definition.

email.description: The email of the user submitting the feedback

token.description: The recaptcha token of the user submitting the feedback

completedAt.description: The timestamp when the job was completed.

resultFileName.description: The file name of the result.

failedAt.description: The timestamp when the job failed.

GetJobByIdEndpoint_Output.description: The result when a job has been retrieved.

name.description: The name of the job definition.

GetJobDefinitionByIdEndpoint_Output.description: The result when a job definition has been retrieved.

workflow.description: The workflow configuration. Can be used directly to create a new revision.

referee.description: The referee configuration. Can be used directly to create a new revision.

createdById.description: The id of the user who created the revision.

createdByMail.description: The email of the user who created the revision.

GetJobRevisionEndpoint_Output.description: The result when a job revision has been retrieved.

ignoreFailedDatapoints.description: whether the order should proceed to be submitted even if certain datapoints failed.

PreviewOrderModel.description: The model for previewing an order.

StickyState.description: Indicates if the underlying campaign should be sticky.

ignoreFailedDatapoints.description: whether the order should proceed to be submitted even if certain datapoints failed.

SubmitOrderModel.description: The model for submitting an order.

name.description: The new name for the job definition.

UpdateJobDefinitionEndpoint_Input.description: The input for the update job definition endpoint.

name.description: The new name for the job.

UpdateJobEndpoint_Input.description: The input for the update job endpoint.

name.description: The new name of the order, if specified.

precedingOrderId.description:
The ID of the order that must complete before this order starts processing.
 Set to null to clear an existing preceding order.

UpdateOrderModel.description: The model for updating properties of an order.

name.description: The new name of the order.

UpdateOrderNameModel.description: The model for updating the name of an order.

Bearer.description: JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme

OAuth2.description: OAuth2 authorization header using the Bearer scheme
